comments.html:
One of the biggest problem with x86 based appliances is called "interface affinity", which means that each interface is mapped to one CPU receiving the interrupt.

So if you have 16 core CPU and only one 10G interface, all the interrupts for that interfaces are handled by one core only.

So be careful when doing a network design for a x86 only appliance.

comments.html: Dan, you should take care about Intel DPDK. Thanks to its Poll Mode Driver (PMD), you don't need anymore to use interrupts and you are fully unlocked and able to scale up to 160Mpps (packet per second) with the latest Intel CPUs.
